title: Supply Planning & Procurement Manager
description:
Ilir Sela started Slice with the belief that local pizzerias deserve all of the advantages of major franchises without compromising their independence. Starting with his family’s pizzerias, we now empower over tens of thousands of restaurants with the technology, services, goods and collective power that owners need to better serve their digitally minded customers and build lasting businesses. We’re growing and adding more talent to help fulfill this valuable mission. That’s where you come in.

 

The Challenge to Solve

Buying affordable, high quality supplies is one of the biggest challenges facing local independent restaurants today; they pay higher prices than franchises and often must use outdated systems to place & receive their orders. Slice’s "The Goods" seeks to solve this challenge by empowering local pizzeria owners to order high-quality supplies at unmatched prices, on demand, in just a few clicks.

 

The Role

As the “ Supply Planning & Procurement Manager”, you’ll be responsible for making sure the right products are in the right place at the right time - ensuring our supply chain supports the growth and reliability of The Goods.

You’ll build and manage the supply plan across a multi-node network, turning forecasts into actionable purchase plans and transfer orders, tracking supplier performance, and resolving disruptions before they impact our pizzeria partners. From demand signals to outbound deliveries, you’ll have visibility across the full supply picture.

The Team

You’ll be part of Slice’s growing Supply Chain team and report directly to the Head of Supply Chain. You’ll collaborate daily with teammates across logistics, customer experience, demand planning, and with our external supplier partners to turn plans into execution.

We’re a collaborative, hands-on team that takes pride in what we’re building. Everyone rolls up their sleeves and we’re looking for someone who’s excited to do the same.

 

The Winning Recipe 

We’re looking for a motivated, detail-oriented supply chain professional who can take ownership of planning and procurement in a fast-paced environment. This role requires someone who can turn forecasts into action, solve problems quickly, and collaborate across teams to ensure product availability.

These are the core competencies this role calls for:

  • Has strong experience in supply planning and inventory management- preferably in CPG, food & beverage, or fast-moving consumer goods.
  • Brings a hands-on approach: you know how to move between data, tools, and supplier calls to keep things on track and avoid surprises.
  • Understands how to turn forecasts into real-time supply strategies across multi-location networks
  • Has experience with PO placement, follow-up, and basic vendor management
  • Is analytical and detail-oriented but fast-moving and focused on outcomes
  • Brings curiosity, urgency, and a problem-solving mindset to everyday challenges

The Extras
Working at Slice comes with a comprehensive set of benefits, but here are some of the unexpected highlights:

  • Flexible PTO
  • Market leading medical, vision and dental insurance
  • 401K matching up to 4%
  • Personal development & wellness reimbursement/stipend
  • Weekly pizza stipend (Yes, that’s a thing!)

Salary Range: $110-$140K + benefits. 

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

The Hiring Process

Here’s what we expect the hiring process for this role to be, should all go well with your candidacy. This entire process is expected to take 2-3 weeks to complete and you’d be expected to start on a specific date.

  • Application
  • 30-minute introductory meeting with a TA Partner
  • 30-minute meeting with our Head of Supply Chain
  • 30 minutes each with Senior Leaders at Slice
  • 30-minute final meeting with our Head of Supply Chain
  • Offer!

Pizza brings people together. Slice is no different. We’re an Equal Opportunity Employer and embrace a diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law. We are also proud members of the Diversity Mark NI initiative as a Bronze Member.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
About Kojo

It's time to build. Whether it's creating more housing, upgrading our infrastructure, or adapting to climate change, one thing is clear: the construction industry is at the center of solving our biggest problems. We’re making buildings cheaper and easier to build by transforming the way commercial construction companies buy their materials. Join us.

Founded in 2018, Kojo is now one of the fastest-growing construction technology companies in the world. Construction accounts for $10 trillion in global spend annually and we can’t live without its output - our roads, schools, hospitals, and offices. Despite this, there’s been very little innovation over the past 70 years in how materials - which constitute up to 40% of project costs - are bought and sold. This is our opportunity.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Accounting Manager to join our dynamic finance team. This role is ideal for someone with strong technical accounting skills and hands-on experience in managing day-to-day financial operations, including payroll. You will be responsible for ensuring the accurate and timely processing of financial transactions, overseeing payroll, and supporting the company’s financial reporting and compliance efforts.

As the Accounting Manager at Kojo Technologies, you will play a critical role in maintaining the company’s financial integrity, ensuring compliance with accounting standards and payroll regulations, and providing accurate financial data to senior management for strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

  • Oversee and manage the day-to-day accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, invoicing, general ledger, and payroll.

  • Ensure accurate and timely processing of payroll for all employees and contractors, including calculating wages, deductions, bonuses, and benefits, while ensuring compliance with all federal, state, and local payroll tax regulations.

  • Assist with monthly close process helping to prepare accurate and timely monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in accordance with GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles).

  • Reconcile accounts, including payroll-related accounts, tax liabilities, employee benefits, and deductions.

  • Maintain up-to-date payroll records for all employees, ensuring compliance with applicable labor laws and tax regulations.

  • Complete monthly sales tax reconciliation and oversee sales tax return filing by Avalara.

  • Oversee invoice collections to ensure customers pay their invoices in a timely manner.

  • Provide financial reports to senior management as needed.

  • Work closely with external auditors during the annual audit process to ensure the accuracy of payroll, tax filings, and related financial data.

  • Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local financial regulations, tax filings, and employment laws, including regular payroll tax filings and reports.

  • Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and compliance within the accounting and payroll functions.

  • Assist in special projects as needed, such as system upgrades, automation initiatives, and process optimization.

About You

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field; CPA or CMA designation preferred.

  • 5+ years of progressive experience in accounting, including payroll management experience.

  • Experience with US payroll processing, including a thorough understanding of US federal, state, and local payroll tax regulations and filings. International applicants must have experience managing US payroll compliance and tax filings for US-based employees.

  • Strong knowledge of GAAP, financial reporting, payroll processing, and regulatory compliance.

  • Proficiency in accounting and payroll software (e.g., Xero, QuickBooks, NetSuite, Rippling, or similar) and Microsoft Excel. Experience with Rippling ideal.

  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.

  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with all levels of the organization.

  • Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy and ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

  • Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, growing environment with a proactive mindset.

  • Experience in international payroll including Canada and LatAm is a plus but not required.

Working at Kojo

Salary: Your salary will be dependent upon many factors, including your experience level, skillset, market dynamics and balancing internal equity relative to other Kojo employees. The compensation and benefits information that we provide is based on Kojo’s good-faith estimate as of the date of the job posting and may be modified in the future.

Benefits: This position is also eligible for a new hire equity grant and all US-based full time employees are eligible for our full suite of perks and benefits. For more information about our perks and benefits, check out https://www.usekojo.com/careers.

Location: Kojo’s team members work from home 100% of the time across North and South America. If applicable, we’ll identify the travel and/or location-specific requirements of a position in the text above. Otherwise, team members can expect to work business hours congruent with their local time zone and remotely.

Inclusive Workplace: Kojo values diverse perspectives and is committed to building an inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. These scams may involve fake job postings, unsolicited emails, or messages claiming to be from our recruiters or hiring managers. Kojo will never ask for any personal account information, such credit card details or bank account numbers, during the recruitment process.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Infrastructure
description:
With the current increase in job recruitment phishing scams globally, we wanted to remind you that all official communications from Synctera will only come from a synctera.com email address.

If you’ve received a communication regarding Synctera that you have a question or concern about, please contact recruiting@synctera.com.

Please note that although all positions at Synctera are remote, candidates must be located and authorized to work in the US or Canada as a precondition of employment. Synctera does not sponsor applicants for work visas.

What We're Doing

At Synctera, we’re powering the future of FinTech. We help companies create new revenue streams and enhance their value proposition with FinTech apps and embedded banking products. With APIs, compliance support, and bank partners in one end-to-end Banking as a Service platform, Synctera is the fastest and easiest way to build, launch, and scale bank accounts, debit cards, charge cards, lending, and more. 

We are looking for interesting, curious, wickedly smart people who are ready to jump in and run with our fast-growing team. If you want to have fun at work, collaborate with some of the sharpest people in the industry, grow the FinTech and Banking as a Service ecosystem, and love to win, read on!

What We're Looking For

As a software engineer on our platform team, you’ll work on all aspects of Synctera’s infrastructure and many components within our overall platform, including a number of core application services, customer and internal-facing infrastructure, and tooling to improve our internal developer experience.

This is a high-autonomy role that will help shape the future of Synctera’s platform and will work directly across a broad swath of product and engineering, being an escalation point for infrastructure questions and other topics that span across teams.

What You’ll Do
  • Collaborate with the product team and engineers to understand financial services challenges and develop effective solutions
  • Help define and drive Synctera’s infrastructure and developer experience roadmap
  • Design, enhance, and maintain Synctera's Google Cloud and CI/CD infrastructure
  • Develop services and utilities in Go
  • Solve engineering problems as part of a small team
  • Work across engineering teams to build top-tier platform tooling and enhance the developer experience
  • Participate in an on-call rotation to ensure platform stability
  • Identify and implement cleaner, more efficient solutions to technical problems.
  • Advocate for modern infrastructure and development best practices, fostering knowledge-sharing across the team
What You’ll Bring
  • Experience with Go or a comparable structured and opinionated language
  • Extensive experience with Kubernetes and related cloud-native technologies like Argo and Istio
  • Experience with monitoring and alerting platform tools such as Prometheus, Alertmanager & Grafana
  • Experience with Terraform or similar infrastructure-as-code tooling
  • Experience with at least one major cloud provider, preferably Google Cloud
Nice to Have
  • Experience with Python / GitLab APIs / Google Cloud APIs / Postgres
  • Familiarity with security compliance frameworks (PCI, SOC 2, SOC 1)
  • Experience being a part of early-stage, fast-moving engineering teams
Our Stack

Our platform is built in Go (for backend services) and React with Typescript (for the Synctera Console, our frontend). We’re built on top of Google Cloud Platform and typically use Postgres (Cloud SQL, AlloyDB), Redis (Cloud Memorystore), and Pub/Sub as our core application stack, with OpenAPI specifications being used to both document our API and be the foundation for inter-service communication.

Our infrastructure is predominantly a mixture of Kubernetes (Google Kubernetes Engine) and Cloud Run (Google’s serverless compute platform), with Terraform orchestrating infrastructure, and tools like Argo facilitating deployments.

Synctera is committed to having a workforce that is reflective of the diversity within the United States and Canada. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from candidates from underrepresented communities, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation and gender identity, and all those who can provide different perspectives and contribute to the diversification of Synctera.

Benefits
  • 100% employer paid medical, dental, and vision benefits for US and Canadian employees and dependents 
  • Employer contribution to HSA for US employees 
  • Annual HCSA and generous extended health care coverage for Canadian employees and dependents 
  • 401(k) for US employees and RRSP for Canadian employees
  • Mental health resources available for all employees 
  • Unlimited paid time off 
  • Generous paid new parent leave program 
  • Home office setup stipend 
  • Stock options program for all employees 
  • Growth potential and opportunity to have a significant impact at an early stage of our company's journey
  • Working alongside a skilled and passionate team

The salary for this full-time position (USD: $160,000-$190,000 CAD: $145,000-$180,000) is determined by role, level, and location. The range informed in this job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries across all US and Canadian locations. Within the range, individual pay will be determined by work location, job-related skills, experience, relevant training, and other factors.

Conception is looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer to join our growing team. This individual will work closely with a talented team of bioinformaticians and will be responsible for the deployment, lifecycle, and stability of Conception’s computational and data storage resources.   • Maintain and extend existing GCP-based compute infrastructure for Conception.

  • Leverage Terraform, Git flow, and infrastructure-as-code best practices for lifecycle management of core infrastructure resources.

Conception is a startup with the mission to generate viable human eggs from induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs).
